summary: The Federal Improvement in Technology Procurement Act (FIT Procurement Act) aims to improve federal technology acquisition. Key provisions include enhancements to the acquisition workforce through experiential learning and ICT training. It also increases the simplified acquisition and micro-purchase thresholds, allows advances for commercial technology subscriptions, and mandates measures to increase competition, particularly for small businesses. The bill also directs assessments by the Comptroller General and updates conflict-of-interest procedures. No new funds are authorized for implementation.
